revised_title: Atmospheric Waves Generated by Large Explosions: A Theoretical Interpretation
tldr: This paper investigates the atmospheric waves caused by large explosions, focusing on nuclear explosions and their effects on the atmosphere. The authors discuss the harmonic oscillations of model atmospheres and the representation of the wave system generated by an explosion as a Fourier integral. They also explore the energy partitioning in a blast wave and the efficiency of rising motion in producing gravity waves.
